t: 2 Samuel 22
Praise for God’s Deliverance
Then*p David spoke to the Lord*s the words of this song, on the day when the Lord*s had delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.
And he said: “The*pn Lord*s is*i my rock and my fortress and my deliverer;
The*ld God of my strength, in whom I will trust; My*ld shield and the horn of my salvation, My*ld stronghold and my refuge; My*ld Savior, You save me from violence.
I*ld will call upon the Lord,*s who*i is*i worthy*i to be praised; So*ld shall I be saved from my enemies.
“When*ln the waves of death surrounded me, The*ld floods of ungodliness made me afraid.
The*ld sorrows of Sheol surrounded me; The*ld snares of death confronted me.
In*ld my distress I called upon the Lord,*s And*ld cried out to my God; He*ld heard my voice from His temple, And*ld my cry entered*i His ears.
“Then*ln the earth shook and trembled; The*ld foundations of heaven quaked and were shaken, Because*ld He was angry.

“The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven, And*ld the Most High uttered His voice.

“The*ln Lord*s rewarded me according to my righteousness; According*ld to the cleanness of my hands He*ld has recompensed me.
For*ld I have kept the ways of the Lord,*s And*ld have not wickedly departed from my God.

Therefore*ld the Lord*s has recompensed me according to my righteousness, According*ld to my cleanness in His eyes.

You*ld will save the humble people; But*ld Your eyes are*i on the haughty, that*i You may bring them*i down.
